solution_line_template: Initially, Louise's cart has toys worth {toy_price} * {num_initial_toys} = <<{toy_price}*{num_initial_toys}={initial_toys_cost}>>{initial_toys_cost} dollars

If Louise pays for the toys originally in her cart, her wallet will remain with {total_money_in_wallet} - {initial_toys_cost} = <<{total_money_in_wallet}-{initial_toys_cost}={remaining_money}>>{remaining_money} dollars.
Dividing the remaining amount by the number of teddy bears gives {remaining_money}/{num_teddy_bears} = <<{remaining_money}/{num_teddy_bears}={cost_per_teddy_bear}>>{cost_per_teddy_bear} dollars.
